title: [Large-Scale] Project to Enhance Learner Agency in Smart Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and general understanding of elementary social studies curriculum
context.additional_context: Current elementary teachers explore methods for designing and operating smart learning environments to enhance learner autonomy, developing practical classroom implementation plans through project execution

learning_goals: Design a learner-customized feedback system utilizing an adaptive learning platform

Within one week, learners develop one social studies project-based learning scenario using one of the virtual/augmented reality tools (Unity, Zepeto, etc.) and secure feasibility scores of 4.0+ (5-point scale) on average via peer review and instructor feedback.

Within one week, learners construct a learner agency assessment rubric with five criteria (goal setting, resource utilization, self-reflection, collaboration skills, time management), define three-tier scales (basic-developing-proficient) for each, and produce a rubric meeting 80%+ suitability (4.0+ average on a 5-point scale) through peer review.

Using digital collaboration tools like Google Workspace or Microsoft Teams, learners establish strategies for managing large groups (>50 learners) within one week (including task distribution, progress monitoring, feedback systems) and obtain approval of 80%+ feasibility from two out of three peer reviewers.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
